newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo Sec, Dongsuh undecided on strikes.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo Sec, Dongsuh undecided on strikes.

text.p: Unions at Daewoo Securities Co and Dongsuh Securities Co were undecided on whether to join nationwide strikes to protest the passage of a controversial labour law, union officials said on Wednesday.
"Our union will vote from today until Friday, and action will be decided based on results," said a Daewoo union official who declined to be identified.
A union official at Dongsuh, who also asked not to be named, said the union was undecided. No further details were available.
The Korean Securities Trade Union called early this week for union workers at securities houses to walk out for an indefinite strike from 1:00 p.m. (0400 GMT) Wednesday.
The new labour law, railroaded through parliament on December 26 with only the ruling party members attending, allows employers to lay off workers, hire temporary employees and replace strikers.
